member.name: T:Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.DispositionNotification
member.summary: Provides properties for constructing a message disposition notification request.
member.remarks: The message disposition notification is used to notify the sender of certain message conditions that may occur after successful delivery of the message.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.DispositionNotification.To
member.summary: Sets the email address for message disposition notifications.
member.remarks: This address will be placed in the Disposition-Notification-To header. The presence of this header field in a message is merely a request for a message disposition notification. The recipient's user agent is always free to silently ignore such a request. Dispostion notifications are defined in RFC-2298.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.EmailMessage.SaveMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Creates and RFC822 file that represents the e-mail message.
member.remarks: This method quickly creates an e-mail file based on the properties of the object. The e-mail file is formatted to standard specifications (RFC 822) and should be understood by other mail programs.
member.param: File name and path to where the message should be saved.
member.exception: Thrown when file cannot be read.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.EmailMessage.ImportFromURI(System.String,System.String,Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.ImportURIFlags)
member.summary: Imports and sets the property with the downloaded contents of the specified uniform resource identifier (URI). To insure the BodyPart is sent correctly, the property is automatically set to and the property is automatically set to .
member.param: The URI of the requested resource.
The base tag that should be the prefix for all Uri's with relative references. i.e. Base = "http://www.quiksoft.com/" img src="/banner.gif" then img src="http://www.quiksoft.com/banner.gif";
One or more of the values specifying how the body is to be imported.
member.exception: Thrown when an error occurs importing a bodypart. See for detailed error codes.

member.name: M:Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.EmailMessage.ImportBody(System.String,Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.BodyPartFormat,Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.ImportBodyFlags)
member.summary: Imports body part data from a system file with various options.
member.param: Path and filename to import.
One of the values specifying the format of the body part to be imported.
One of the values specifying the way the file is imported.
member.remarks: This method automatically creates a object from the imported data. If the is specified as BodyPartFormat.HTML, then the imported file data is automatically parsed and any references to embedded images stored on the local file system are automatically imported into the message as objects with a unique content id. The HTML is modified to reference the content id in-lieu-of the reference to the image file. References to images outside of the local file system, such as a URL, or references to the file system that can not be accessed are ignored and left as-is in the HTML. If the parameter contains the ImportBodyFlags.CreateAlternativeText, this method will also parse the HTML and attempt to render a plain text version of the message which will be added as an additional object to support an alternative text version of the message for mail readers that do not understand HTML. This functionality works best with simple HTML messages.
member.exception: Thrown when the file being imported cannot be opened or read.

member.remarks: Setting this property will cause an "X-Priority" header to be added to the message with the value specified. Different mail readers may interpret the X-Priority setting differently. Some may not interpret it at all. The popular readers interpret "4"=low, "3"=normal and "1"=high.

member.remarks: The value specified by this property is used with the SMTP "MAIL FROM" command during the SMTP conversation. member.name: T:Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.License
member.summary: Provides a static property for setting the license key.
member.remarks: A license key is similar to a registration code, or serial number. It is a unique string that identifies the licensee and the type of license. The property must be assigned a valid license key to unlock the assembly. Both permanent and trial (temporary) license keys can be obtained from Quiksoft. If a valid license key is not properly assigned to the property, or if there is a error in the format of the license key, the assembly will not be unlocked, and will throw a from most method calls. When using a license key, please remember these important points: The license key is case sensitive. The license key is unique to each licensee and product. The license key can not contain any line breaks. Your license key must be assigned to the property exactly as you received it without modification of any sort. The property should be assigned before the assembly is used. The License object is static, so there is no need to create an instance of it prior to assigning the property.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.License.Key
member.summary: Gets and sets the license key.
member.value: This property holds the license key for the assembly. If this property is not assigned a valid license key, the object will throw a from most methods.
member.remarks: The object and the Key property are static. You can not create an instance of the object. For more information on license keys, see the remarks on the object.

member.name: T:Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.ISMTPSASL
member.summary: Used to implement a Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) Interface.
member.remarks: The SASL interface can be used to add custom authentication mechanisms to the EasyMail assebmlies. Any class that inherits from this interface will be referred to as a SASL mechanism. The Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) is a method for adding authentication support to connection-based protocols. To use this specification, a protocol includes a command for identifying and authenticating a user to a server and for optionally negotiating a security layer for subsequent protocol interactions. A list of currently registered SASL mechanisms can be found at the below URL. http://www.iana.org/assignments/sasl-mechanisms

member.name: M:Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.ISMTPSASL.GetMechanismCommand(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the command to initiate the authentication with the server.
member.param:
The protocol which authentication is be requested for.
1-SMTP
2-POP3
3-IMAP4
member.returns: A string containing the command to send to the server.
member.remarks: The default SASL command for POP3 and SMTP is "AUTH" and the default for IMAP4 is "AUTHENTICATE"

member.name: M:Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.ISMTPSASL.DataAvailable(System.String)
member.summary: Called when data is available from the server.
member.param: Data recived from the connection.
member.returns:
The response to send back to the server. The mechanism should return a null or empty value if no data is to be sent and the authentication was successfull.
If an error occurs the mechanism should throw an exception that will propagate the back to the caller.

member.name: P:Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.BodyPart.AutoWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of characters allowed per line before the body is wrapped.
member.remarks: Some Internet mail systems have trouble processing messages with lines longer than 76 characters. Setting this property's value to any value greater than 0 turns on the AutoWrap feature and the message body text will be word wrapped so that no line contains more than the number of characters specified. When encoding a BodyPart with Quoted-Printable (default) or Base64, you do not need to turn this feature on because the encoding algorithm will automatically wrap the text. AutoWrap should only be used with plain text messages that are not encoded. If you are unsure, leave this property set to zero.
member.value: The maximum number of characters allowed per line before the body text is wrapped. Default: 0 (off).

member.name: T:Quiksoft.EasyMail.SMTP.BodyPartItem
member.summary: Provides properties and methods for adding embedded content related to one or more body parts. i.e. Embedded images in an HTML message. See remarks.
member.remarks:
The BodyPartItem class is used to attach and associate data with one or more body parts of a message. The most common application of this is adding embedded images to an HTML message. In this example, each image would be represented by one BodyPartItem object. The data is added to the message by specifying its filename in the property. The data is associated with the HTML message by its which is specified in the HTML as the source for the image data.
If you are creating HTML messages and you wish to embed content such as images, the method will automatically import an HTML file and create the the BodyPartItem objects for you and. These objects will be automatically added to the .
The BodyPartItem and BodyPartItemCollection classes are available for developers who wish to manually create the embedded content, or who wish to fine tune it after importing with .
